Package it.trvi.vendorsftpconnection

Class MessageExchanger

java.lang.Object
it.trvi.vendorsftpconnection.MessageExchanger
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SFTPBasedMessageExchangerForAmazonVendor
public abstract class MessageExchanger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
Abstract class that defines a simple tool to send and receive String messages.

      public MessageExchanger()

  • Method Details

    • send

      public abstract void send​(java.lang.String msg) throws MessageForwardingException
      Sends a message.
      Parameters:
      msg - contains the message to be sent
      Throws:
      MessageForwardingException - if an error prevents the sending of the message

    • receive

      public abstract java.lang.String receive() throws MessageReceptionException, java.util.NoSuchElementException
      If there's a message waiting to be received, it immediately returns it. Otherwise, it throws a NoSuchElemetException.
      Returns:
      the received message
      Throws:
      MessageReceptionException - if an error prevents the sending of the message
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there's no message waiting to be received

    • waitForMessage

      public java.lang.String waitForMessage​(int waitTime) throws MessageReceptionException
      If there's a message waiting to be received, it immediately returns it. Otherwise, it waits until such a message exists, then it returns it. It tries to receive a message every waitTime milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      waitTime - is the time, in milliseconds, that it must wait between each reception attempt
      Returns:
      the received message
      Throws:
      MessageReceptionException - if an error prevents the receiving of the message

    • waitForMessageForMilliseconds

      public java.lang.String waitForMessageForMilliseconds​(int totalWaitTime, int waitTime) throws MessageReceptionException, java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
      If there's a message waiting to be received, it immediately returns it. Otherwise, it waits at most totalWaitTime milliseconds for a message to arrive. If the message arrives within totalWaitTime milliseconds, then it returns it as soon as it receives it, otherwise it throws a TimeoutException. It tries to receive a message every waitTime milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      totalWaitTime - is the maximum amount of milliseconds that must be waited. If it's not a multiple of waitTime, it's approximated to the following multiple of waitTime
      waitTime - is the time, in milliseconds, that it must wait between each reception attempt
      Returns:
      the received message
      Throws:
      MessageReceptionException - if an error prevents the receiving of the message
      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if it doesn't receive a message withing millis milliseconds (approximated as explained above)

    • close

      public abstract void close()
      If the underlying communication is connection-oriented, it closes the connection. Otherwise, it does nothing. If the connection is already closed, it does nothing.
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
